intro: Phyllostegia kaalaensis, commonly known as the Kalaensis strobilanthes, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Kauai in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple and white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
